function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Drugs used for treatment of COVID-19 patients may pollute freshwater resources","Impact":"Intensified pollution problem, potential health risks from contaminated water","Mitigation":"Improved wastewater treatment, proper management of urban water cycle, sufficient disinfection of water and wastewater treatment plants","Technologies":"Advanced water treatment technologies, wastewater treatment plants, sewage leakage prevention measures","People":"Communities relying on freshwater resources, residents in areas with inadequate wastewater treatment","Owner":"Local governments, water treatment facilities, environmental agencies"},{"Description":"Coronavirus can spread through fecal-oral routes, requiring proper management of urban water cycle","Impact":"Increased spread of the virus through contaminated water sources","Mitigation":"Sufficient disinfection of water plants and wastewater treatment plants, prevention of sewage leakage into freshwater resources","Technologies":"Water disinfection technology, sewage leakage prevention measures","People":"General population, communities relying on urban water systems","Owner":"Local health authorities, water treatment facilities, environmental agencies"},{"Description":"Lack of sewage treatment facilities in densely populated areas like India poses challenges for containing the spread of COVID-19 through water sources","Impact":"Undermined lockdown measures, increased risk of virus spread through contaminated water","Mitigation":"Resource allocation for onsite water and wastewater treatment by households, development of sewage treatment facilities in densely populated areas","Technologies":"Onsite water and wastewater treatment systems, sewage treatment facilities","People":"Residents in densely populated areas, communities with inadequate sewage treatment facilities","Owner":"Local governments, public health agencies, urban planning authorities"}]}
